turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Great.  Because, like I said, until you find it, we can't let you on the plane.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You don't understand.  The man I'm supposed to marry is on that plane.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Okay, ma'am, just a moment.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: You didn't have that with you before.  Prima non l'aveva con se.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It was late in arriving.  But it's here now.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You ask what room he's in, okay?

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: Buona notte.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: Mr. Bradley left about a half hour ago.  He said his plans had changed unexpectedly.  Would you prefer an interior or exterior room?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He couldn't have checked out-- I was supposed to meet him here.

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: I'm very sorry.  Perhaps you misunderstood?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Nobody here has any idea which way he went?

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: Once they pay the bill, we don't usually follow them.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No...  it's just very important that I find him, okay?

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Because.

turns.speaker: CONCIERGE
turns.text: He said he thinks a woman he works with knows him.  Her name's Anna. But she won't be in 'til tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So.  How do we get to Rome?

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: So, what's the story with your friend?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: My friend has lost her fucking mind...

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: What's she doing?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: She's trying to find out where she can rent a loudspeaker.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So she can drive through the streets of Rome paging the man of her dreams.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: No, really.  What's she doing?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Really.  She thinks he's here. Even though she's never met him. Even though she's never laid eyes on him.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: Seriously.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: Were they pen pals?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: Is he some kind of celebrity or something?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAMON
turns.text: Did he do some anonymous good deed for her?

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: There's this poem by Rilke, I don't remember the whole thing, but it's about that.  About waiting for that person, and wondering if you'll ever find them.  And the last line of it goes, "Who knows?  Perhaps the same bird echoed through both of us, yesterday--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: --separate, in the evening..."

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: My hair's kind of a mess, isn't it?

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Your hair... is perfect.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: But...  just to be sure, maybe we ought to shatter each other's unrealistic images of perfection. You know, each of us admit something embarrassing about ourselves.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Okay.  Good idea.  You first.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I feel like I've been wandering in the desert for as long as I can remember.  With nothing but emptiness around me, wind and sun...  And suddenly, out of the blue, somehow I've found the oasis.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, right.  Dwayne.  You're engaged to Dwayne?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It just happened.  I didn't plan it.  I was alone.  And he was... there.  But now everything's changed.  I owe it to him to let him know.  I need to tell him.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: You're sure...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I've never been more sure of anything in my life.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Let's find a telephone.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Sure-- But, before you do that, since we're putting all our cards on the table, I have a confession to make, too.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't be afraid.  You can tell me.

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: You're sure...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We found each other, didn't we?

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: Yes.  We did.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It's alright...  this is our destiny.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAMON'S MOTHER
turns.text: My name isn't Damon Bradley.  I just told you it was Damon Bradley.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I don't get it.  She hasn't seen her since she was a kid, now just because she's dying, all of the sudden she's gotta see her again?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: She's been acting weird lately, though.  I shoulda seen it coming. Babbling on and on and on about "communication".  Like I don't know how to communicate.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Let's face it.  Sooner or later we all die.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Who's dying?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Your great aunt.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: What great aunt?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You don't think this is just infatuation, do you?

turns.speaker: FRANCESCA
turns.text: Oh no.  Do you?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'm a liberal!

turns.speaker: FRANCESCA
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: My car bumper has never held a winning sticker.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: There is one other thing you should know about me.

turns.speaker: FRANCESCA
turns.text: Nothing you could say would change the way I feel.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'm engaged.  I'm supposed to be married in two days.

turns.speaker: FRANCESCA
turns.text: Except possibly that.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: And, he's a friend of yours.  It's Dwayne.

turns.speaker: FRANCESCA
turns.text: Dwayne?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Dwayne Pinsley.  From high school. That's how I knew you were here. When you called, from the airport.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: A very large pig.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Ask her if she knows where he is?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Sa dov'e' lui?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Ask her if she knows how I might reach him?  If she has a telephone number?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Ha un numero di telefono?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: ...has a prior commitment.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What's mezzaluna?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: A restaurant.  In Piazza Navona.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That's it.  That's it.  That's all I need to know.  Bless you, thank you, thank you.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I'M NOT PUSHING IT.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Wait.  I have to write this down.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah, but, what if this guy lived a billion, trillion years ago? Like, what if he was a cave man, and now he's dead?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't be stupid, Larry.  If he's my destiny, then, obviously, he has to be alive.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah, but, what if he doesn't live here?  Like, what if he's a cannibal in New Guinea or something?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: If I live here, then he lives here. Fate wouldn't make a mistake like that.  And stop talking.  You're gonna ruin the spell.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: We'll KNOW.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Okaaaaayyyy.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Larry!  What are you doing here?  Mom sent you.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Larry, can I borrow your car keys?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Faith, this guy you think is Mr. Right, he's... not what you think--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't worry, it's a long story, but I know who he is.  I know where to find him.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: But, Faith--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Please, Larry.  I have to hurry.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'll bring it back as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: But Faith--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Hi there...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Before you start picking your nose, I know he put you up to it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It was the moth stuff that gave it away, didn't it?  I knew that was too much.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, you gave a very convincing performance.  And you'll be pleased to know that your eight-by-ten glossy is now on display at the local playhouse.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My picture's up?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So, this is what you do?  I mean when you're not playing other parts?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I take it things didn't work out between the two of you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's an amazing place, don't you think?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Amazing.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Smoking or non-smoking?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Non.  Please.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Lots of history.  For example, did you know, according to legend, this coastline used to harbor Sirens?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hm.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Beautiful women who could lure men to their destruction with their singing.  Nobody's ever really seen them and lived to tell about it. But, I don't know.  An awful lot of ships wrecked on those rocks.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hello?  Is anybody there?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Dwayne Pinsley?  I'm trying to reach Dwayne Pinsley.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He's not in at the moment.  Can I take a message?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: This is his fiancee.  Who's this?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Oh, hi.  I'm an old high school buddy of Dwayne's.  I was in town this weekend, was hoping to stop by and surprise him. But I've gotta catch a plane so I'm afraid I'm not gonna be able to make it.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I'm sure he'll be sorry to hear that.  Who should I tell him called?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: My name's

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I can hardly hear you.  Could you spell that?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Damon Bradley...

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Right.  Thanks a lot.  And congratulations.  It's not easy finding love these days.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: WAIT!!  Where are you?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: I'm at the airport.  Why?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Uh-- in case Dwayne wants to try to reach you.

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Well, he'd have to hurry.  My flight leaves at four o'clock.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: I'm on my way to Venice.  Why?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Venice?  I love Venice.  With the boats, right?...

turns.speaker: PHONE
turns.text: Huh?  Uh, yeah-- I've gotta run. Tell Dwayne hi.  Maybe someday we can all get together.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That's not the point.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You said whatever it was you would understand.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That was before I found out what it was.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: How could you do this to me?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm in love with you.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh, come on...  What kind of an excuse is that?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You're limping.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I know I'm limping.  I stubbed my toe.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Are you okay?  You want some help?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: NO.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You are leaving, aren't you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why can't you just tell me?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: If it's any of your business, yes.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes?!  To be married, I suppose.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: To the foot doctor.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Because I know who Dwayne is, and he's reliable and stable and wants to marry me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He's safe.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So?!  Is there something wrong with loving somebody who's safe?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Does he love you?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He wants to marry me, doesn't he?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You didn't answer my question.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why are you asking me this?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Because I'd like to think at least one of you feels that way.  Does he  know who you are?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You stubbed your toe, don't you think that's a sign?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He's a podiatrist.  Pain is your body's way of telling you something is wrong.  Your toe is trying to tell you not to do it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: There must be something I can do, something I can say to make this up to you?...  Just tell me what it is, I'll say it.  I'll do it. I don't want you to hate me.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Look, Peter, I don't hate you. But what we had was an illusion. Mutual wishful thinking.  We both wanted to believe it for awhile, but it was all founded on a lie.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So it wasn't real.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What about the oasis in the desert? Are you telling me that was a lie?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, that wasn't a lie.  That was...  a mirage.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Don't you see?..  We're not the ones who are meant to be.  You're the man of somebody else's dreams.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Because I don't have the right name?!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Fine.  Okay.  Forget me.  Leave me out of it.  But don't go throwing your life away on somebody you don't love.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Who says I don't love him?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Because.  I know where he is.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I went back to that restaurant and I spoke with his waiter, just on an off chance, you know, and, anyway-- he knew the name of the guy's hotel.  So, I called there, they said he left yesterday.  But, apparently he comes here every year, always follows the same route.  He always goes from here down the coast to the Le Sirenuse hotel in Positano.  I called.  And they told me he's checked in.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Where's Positano?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's in the south.  I've still got my rental car.  I can get you there by morning...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh no, I don't think that would be a good idea.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Look, I know there's no going back for us.  That's not it.  I just want to make this up to you.  Clear my relationship karma.  And I know the area, I've got some cousins down there.  Please.  Let me do this for you.  Let this be my gift to you.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Because-- I want you to be happy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The guy at the hotel told me he always wears a gold medallion, and usually has a book or magazine with him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: He likes to read...  Did he mention anyone in particular?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Uh, I'd rather not say.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'd really rather not say.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Please.  I need to know.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Mickey Spillane.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Mickey Spillane?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Or Hustler.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He's out by the pool right now.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Right now?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, and I forgot to tell you.  He's here with his mother.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Do you want me to do it?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: NO.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hi, Peter.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So.  You found him.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You found him.  I don't know how to thank you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, it looks like we both lucked out.  I just met somebody myself. Somebody my aunt introduced me to.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh.  That's nice.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And she's a knock-out, too.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, good.  Good for you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Anyway, that's why I came by.  I need to fix this button.  Do you have a needle and thread?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Where are you going?  Just-- out of curiosity...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Just to that place down at the bottom of the stairs.  Nothing fancy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, thanks.  Well, have a good time.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hey--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Nice dress.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Thank you, Peter.  Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We were hungry.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You were saying...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Boy, that looks tasty.  What is that?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Say, I saw where they had motor boats for rent down in the harbor. Why don't we all go for an evening cruise around the bay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I don't know if that's such a--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I just wanted to keep an eye on you.  The guy's a total stranger, remember?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: So were you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Exactly.  Besides, no hard feelings.  You found somebody.  I found somebody. I thought we could double.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, what about books?  You like Hemingway?  You gotta love Hemingway.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The Sun Also Rises.  For Whom the Bell Tolls.  The Old Man and the--

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: How about music?  You like classical?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The Boston Pops.  Season tickets.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, how about those old romantic movies with those great stars, huh? Like Audrey Hepburn.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Actually, I think I prefer Katherine Hepburn.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I guess he turned out to be kind of a loser, huh?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I feel like the world's biggest idiot.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah.  Well, was the least I could do.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, it was more than that.  It was very generous of you.  It was very kind.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Promise me you won't leave without saying goodbye.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  Course not.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Hi.  Are you... busy?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.  Are you're leaving?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  I just came by to apologize.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: It seems like ever since I found out about this guy, this name, I've been kind of crazy.  Like I was on drugs or something.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know the feeling.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yeah...  Well, anyway, I also wanted to tell you, I'm not getting married.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You aren't?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No.  I mean yes, I'm not.  I decided to call it off.  Well, actually, it was kind of mutual.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well.  Congratulations.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Thank you.  So, since I have a few more days of vacation left, I was wondering if maybe you'd want to do something sometime.  I mean, you know, if you don't have... other plans.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Are you asking me out?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes.  I am.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: In that case... no...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You can't come to Southern Italy and not see the Blue Grotto.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I just need to run up and get my bathing suit.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay.  I'll meet you at the dock in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is something the matter?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: GET OUT!!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'd call that a yes.  Do I get a hint?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You want a hint?  I'll give you a hint.  You are the lowest, most despicable, most reprehensible form of reptilian swine--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: There's no such thing.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Reptilian swine.  There's no such thing.  Reptiles aren't swine.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Who cares?!  You hired an actor??

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.  Who told you that?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No one had to tell me.  He's starring in the local play.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Alright.  The truth is... I thought we had something here.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I can't believe you did that!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And I can't believe you are so stubborn and so blind as to let some stranger, some phantom you've never even met destroy it.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You're the reason I never met him. You knew it was the thing I most wanted in life and you sabotaged it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I sabotaged it?  You're the one who lost him, remember?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Well, I might've found him again if I hadn't left Rome to make this pointless trip down here with you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: As I recall, you were on your way home.  And I didn't want you to go so, yes, I told you a little white lie.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: A "little white lie"?  A "little white lie"?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What would you call it?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I would call it-- unforgivable.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Don't you think you're overreacting just a little here?   We're talking about love, okay?  Let's be rational.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Rational?!  Love is not rational! Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes.  I'm crazy.  You have driven me crazy.  No one in their right mind would go to this much trouble to win over someone as insane as you.  Did it ever, even for one second, occur to you how much work it was to set all this up?  How many arrangements had to be made? How many players had to be coordinated?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Gee, I'm flattered.  What an incredibly romantic gesture. Cancel the roses, I've decided to lie to her instead.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Very funny.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: No, it isn't.  I called off my wedding all because of you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Really?...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: And this is the thanks I get.  I did you a favor.  You never wanted to marry that joker in the first place.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: That's not the point.  And what if I had wanted to?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: If you had wanted to, you'd have gone home.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Look, I just thought if you finally got rid of this obsession with this name, if you could get it out of your system once and for all, then maybe you'd be able to stop waiting and open your heart to someone real.  Granted, ideally, me.  I didn't do it to hurt you.  I did it for you.  I did it for us...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: There is no us.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I was hoping for the real thing.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I brought you that, too.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You're Damon Bradley?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Beautiful place...

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Sure is.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Been here long?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Just since yesterday.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I just got here, too.  Not yesterday.  But, just now.  Today. Just a few minutes ago.  Yeah, we just got here...  I mean, I just got here.  I'm single.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: I was wondering...  Do you have dinner plans?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Any night.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Well, not exactly...

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Would you be willing to have dinner with me?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: You would?  Really?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: I'll look forward to it.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Okay.  Good.  See you then, then.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Aren't you going to tell me who you are?

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Oh, Faith.  My name's Faith.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: It's a pleasure to meet you, Faith.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Brunello di Montalcino, '85, please.

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: You know, I noticed you out at the pool even before we spoke.  I could sense the chemistry between us.

turns.speaker: FAITH
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HIM
turns.text: Really...
